entry.title: Deprecate AttestationEnabledForUser policy
entry.content:
This change deprecates the AttestationEnabledForUser enterprise policy.

This policy allowed enterprises to enable Remote Attestation for a

managed user. However, the policy has been unconditionally set to true

in launch/227712 and the last use of the policy was cleaned up in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4561753.

Thus, the policy is no longer needed.

entry.title: [iOS] Move actions on the tab grid out of synchronization disabler
entry.content:
Reland "[iOS] Disable EarlGrey synchronization when accessing camera"



This is a reland of commit 9372c83b9c10e5e73428b558aea4b6e8f0fd9a6a,

and an attempt to fix testDismissPermissionsWhenIncognitoKilled which

has failed since the update.



Original failure message states that it could not find the close button

of the test tab on the tab grid, but the element could be located in the

printed UI hierarchy.



Judging from the long list of currently animating elements at the end of

the message, I suspect that the error was due to that the assertion was

performed with synchronization disabled. Moving the lines of code out

as the video element would not be visible at its full size when that

assertion is performed.



Original change's description:

> [iOS] Disable EarlGrey synchronization when accessing camera

>

> It is suspected that the video element in the test page performs some

> fast repetitive animations that, combined with the EarlGrey

> synchronization, delays the invocation of the infobar appearance

> animation completion block. As a workaround, we disables EarlGrey

> synchronization whenever the test is showing the video element.

>

> Change-Id: I914999fd925ce9220842a6d7b5e27370f5cf670e

> Bug: 1462372

entry.title: base::RandBytes: switch implementation to BoringSSL
entry.content:
On POSIX:



1. Remove the experiments to compare the RAND_bytes (from BoringSSL)

with getrandom(2).



2. Simplify to remove getrandom(2) entirely. This leads to

base::internal::RandDoubleAvoidAllocation() not being able to use

faster fallbacks: getrandom(2) on Linux/Android and getentropy(3) on

MacOS. These calls should not happen often in the field, so the

platform-specific conditional compilation with runtime kernel version

detection needed for those fallbacks are not worth keeping.



On Windows and Fuchsia: Remove the BoringSSL experiment in the most

straightforward way.



Also remove the experiment from the fieldtrial_testing_config.



Bug: 1291287

entry.title: [Bookmarks] client_ gets destructed before the observer list.
entry.content:
Before this CL, the observer list was destructed before client_.

Since `client_` owns a BookmarkClient and some client (at least

`ChromeBookmarkClient`) observer the bookmark model, it is

important that the client is destructed before the list. This caused

the destruction of a non-empty list.



While reordering parameters would suffice to ensure the right order,

adding the destruction of the client explicitly in the destructor of

the model ensure that this requirement is explicitly met, even if

members of the class were to be reordered.



`TutledUrlIndex` owns a `TypedCountSorter` that keeps a raw_ptr to the client. So `titled_url_index_` must be reset before the `client_`.

Hence this CL also had to explicitly stops `titled_url_index_` before

`client_`.



There may remain more dependencies in the order of destructor that are

not explicited in comment. The goal of this CL was not to make them

all explicit, only to ensure the observer list contains less elements

at destruction time.







This CL will allow to check it on observer list destruction in

crrev.com/c/4742500.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Icaeee162580848829ff83861d1ed561df929de1f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4755448

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Arthur Milchior

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181469}

entry.title: Revert "avif_image_decoder: Use libavif's yuv to rgb function"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 56846997d568ab8fadddfc2605a2f891231d6524.



Reason for revert: Seems to be causing blink_platform_unittests failures like https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25787/overview



Original change's description:

> avif_image_decoder: Use libavif's yuv to rgb function

>

> Get rid of the pixel by pixel loop in the wrapper and use

> libavif's conversion function instead. It uses libyuv if the

> image's color configuration supports it, otherwise has built-in C

> code which is slightly faster in some cases. It also has support

> for multi-threaded conversion which is better.

>

> The PaintCanvasVideoRenderer (PCVR) path is still retained and

> will be used if the image's color configuration supports it.

>

> Also relax the pixel error tolerance from 1 to 2 for two 12-bit

> YUVA test images because libavif uses libyuv for those files.

> libyuv's fixed-point arithmetic is less accurate than

> gfx::ColorTransform's floating-point arithmetic (similar to

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3546131)

>

> Performance is mostly neutral with some files being ~50% faster.

>

> Binary size increase is due to a few new libavif functions being

> accessed. Worth the performance/code re-use benefits.

>

> Change-Id: Ib61bc7a8905b986c946f97e4791f02d81d1af3fe

> Binary-Size: See reasoning above.

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4698835

> Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

> Reviewed-by: Wan-Teh Chang

> Commit-Queue: Vignesh Venkat

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181018}

entry.title: Revert "[Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 05814c3e332d07ebe24cec4b6c7ddf46ca8403dd.



Reason for revert: causing persistent failures in services_unittests,

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25787/overview



Original change's description:

> [Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session

>

> This is a continuation of the work in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748603

> which I'm taking over. Credit to mastiz@ for most of this change.

>

> If sync metadata is deleted from storage, SessionStore will ignore the

> tab upon browser restart. This is problematic on Android because

> placeholder tabs rely on the information being restored from

> SessionStore.

>

> This CL changes the behavior of remote deletion of the local session

> so that in addition to resubmitting the local session data the metadata

> changes are also dropped. This prevents the deletion from SessionStore

> so that placeholder tabs are retained and resubmitted.

>

> Also move SyncingState.local_data_out_of_sync into SessionSyncPrefs to

> persist across restarts. This avoids an issue where on a quick

> restart this bit may be lost causing data to not be resubmitted and

> fight back against the remote deletion.

>

> Bug: 1463772

> Change-Id: I5b85f5424ab0e7ab93759f264408a7e9d2d4d232

entry.title: [iOS] Allow Spacing Increase If Info Button Is Hidden
entry.content:
TableViewInfoButtonItem has functionality to hide the info button, but

the constraint wasn't properly set up in a way where the UI looked like

space was added for a button that was invisible. Please see UI

screenshot for reference. Although this is what happens visually, what

actually is causing this UI bug is the logic that space is added for

`statusTextLabel` even if it doesn't exist. To fix this, we separate

the constraints related to the UILabel and activate/deactivate related

constraints based on if the UILabel was initialized.



UI Screenshots:

Standard:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BiVEYgonMyHByjVoXNi8X2a17608Azc-/view?usp=drive_link&resourcekey=0-0URX4AvIJUOIstkYBBoODA



Accessibility Enabled:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TFJVUzOADdgrqnniPSRoySwqaGy1Rj5s/view?usp=drive_link&resourcekey=0-YwQEaToOjxlW8vRGK3euQQ

entry.title: [base][test] TestFuture: only initialize runloop inside Wait() call
entry.content:
Previously the TestFuture would create a RunLoop on construction,

thereby requiring that the calling thread already has a message-

pump associated with it.



In some tests the message-pump (usually TaskEnvironment) will

only be created after the test object's construction (e.g. as

part of SetUp()). Since those run after the test base-class has

been constructed, this would prevent TestFuture being a member

of the test base-class.



TestFuture now follows the best-practice of creating the RunLoop

only when it actually wants to run the message-pump, in Wait(),

allowing it to be created & destroyed independent of the

message-pump lifetime.

When an autocomplete entry is deleted the whole popup is recreated. This leads to the cursor being inside a row from the beginning. Due to our mouse being outside the bounds check, this forces the user to have to move the cursor out and in, which is annoying.



This code also deleted DeleteButtonAccessibilityDelegate which is no longer used, plus renames the method to create the autocomplete row.



please note: There is still a bug where a mouse movement is required to get the cell highlighted. I am working on it.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 8d89dfa60440c6097262793f332bb1985fc79829.



Reason for revert: to be replaced by crrev.com/c/4760966.



As suggested by John, //content should not know about Autofill and

thus should not contain an Autofill base::Feature.



We can call blink::WebRuntimeFeatures::EnableSharedAutofill()

manually in ChromeContentRendererClient::

SetRuntimeFeaturesDefaultsBeforeBlinkInitialization() instead.

> Remove dependency in //content/child on //components/autofill

> //components/autofill to //content to eliminate the dependency

> in //content/child on //components/autofill.

entry.title: Avoid dangling reference to MigratableCreditCard in MigrateCardsRequest.
entry.content:
Currently, MigrateCardsRequest has a reference that can become dangling:

1) On construction, MigrateCardsRequest stores a reference to a vector

of MigratableCreditCard that is owned by the caller.

2) However, the caller is FormDataImporter and FormDataImporter's

lifetime is shorter than that of the MigrateCardsRequest: The former

gets destroyed before PaymentsClient

(the owner of MigrateCardsRequest) and the destruction order is

correct, because members of FormDataImporter assume that

PaymentClient outlives them.

3) Therefore, on destruction of AutofillClient (but potentially also

in other scenarios if FormDataImporter ever resets its members)

the reference that MigrateCardsRequest keeps, becomes invalid.



This CL changes MigrateCardsRequest to keep a copy instead.



However, this change triggered a few more build config changes:

- MigrateCardsRequest only exists on Desktop, but was previously

included for all OSes. However, MigratableCreditCard is not included

in the iOS and Android builds. As soon as one changes the member from

a reference to a vector to an actual vector, a forward declaration

is no longer enough.

- This CL therefore also excludes MigrateCardsRequest from iOS and

Android builds. This should slightly improve binary size (by ~2.7 KB)

at the cost of a few ifdefs.



Bug: 1468967

Change-Id: I83f7cec6a8abcfc1133292a7bf1d566f1a145d3f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753425

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Olivia Saul

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: Florian Leimgruber

entry.title: Revert "Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 68270ff9259076cd7bc9b398f88d4043166ee676.



Reason for revert: Likely the cause of crbug.com/1471415



Original change's description:

> Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer

>

> This CL:

> -Adds a mojom::AutofillFormAction enum denoting the browser autofill

> operation that sent a form to the renderer.

> -Adds an ApplyAutofillAction function to form_util with intent to merge

> the two deleted functions.

> -Adapts FillFormField and PreviewFormField and ClearPreviewedElements

> to handle both Fill and Undo operations.

> -Fixes typos and clang warnings in touched files

>

> The overall chain of CLs adds a preview feature to the existing Undo

> functionality. Up until this CL, the browser has the required logic and

> sends the necessary information to the renderer. This CL's goal is to

> first make Undo previewable and second merge the Undo and Fill functions

> in the renderer because they are highly similar.

>

entry.title: [SAA][Settings] Fix lingering dom elements after reset exception
entry.content:
When a collapsible exception was removed while opened, the iron-collapse

element was left behind and shown on the UI (see video in b:294875621)

if before a static-list-entry (i.e. embargoed entry). Removing

cr-lazy-render fixes the problem, although we cannot pinpoint the reason

why.



This CL substitutes cr-lazy-render by dom-if. We don't expect a

(significant) performance dip since dom-if will only render the element

when the if becomes true for the first time (lazy render), and then

hides the elements on subsequent changes to the if value. This is

similar to how cr-lazy-render along with iron-collapse worked.



Demo of fixed behaviour: http://dr/file/d/1Q-WxRFlGSpMUxY6gu9Qcg2kW0FsbVofw/view



Fixed: b:294875621

Bug: 1433644, 1471396

entry.title: [iOS] Add Save to Photos service
entry.content:
- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service.h

- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service.mm

The Photos service is responsible for providing a high-level access to

the Photos Library API to implement Save to Photos. It will be created

by a PhotosServiceFactory which will use a provider to return the actual

implementation.

1. ios/chrome/browser/providers/photos/: return an unavailable service

2. ios/chrome/test/providers/photos/: return a fake

3. internally return the actual implementation



- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service_configuration.h

- ios/chrome/browser/photos/photos_service_configuration.mm

This configuration will be used by the provider to configure the service

implementation to be returned.

entry.title: Send SkImage to CanvasAsyncBlobCreator::EncodeImageOnEncoderThread
entry.content:
To encode the image on a worker thread, we currently access the

pixel data via `this->src_data_`. This needs to be eliminated

if we want to stop using CrossThreadPersistent. This CL instead

sends a SkImage reference to the worker thread, which should be

safe, since the underlying bitmap held by SkImage is immutable.

We also send a std::unique_ptr to the worker,

but this is mostly as a way to transport `src_data_`.

(SkPixmap does not have a CrossThreadCopier, so it can't be sent

directly).



As of this CL, there should not be any remaining accesses to `this`,

except for the calls to WrapCrossThreadPersistent(this).



Bug: 1370013

Change-Id: If8c271d14d3103fc745e7b65c9bce39ce7e845f7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4751820

entry.title: Don't keep pointer to popped stack memory for :has()
entry.content:
The sibling_features pass into UpdateFeaturesFromCombinator may be

initialized to last_compound_in_adjacent_chain_features if null. The

outer while loop in

AddFeaturesToInvalidationSetsForLogicalCombinationInHas() could then

reference to the last_compound_in_adjacent_chain_features which is

popped from the stack on every outer iteration. That caused an ASAN

failure for reading stack memory that had been popped.



Instead make sure each inner iteration restarts with the same

sibling_features pointer, which seems to have been the intent here.



Bug: 1470477

Change-Id: I260c93016f8ab0d165e4b29ca1aea810bede5b97

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/content_settings/core/browser
entry.content:
The public interface of this target do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.

See [proof].



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

not going to be able to stand alone completely. Its public_config is not

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile some dependents.



[proof]: https://source.chromium.org/search?q=%23include.*base%20file:.h&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc:components%2Fcontent_settings%2Fcore%2Fbrowser%2F



Bug: chromium:1467773

entry.title: Use the normal border color for bubbles with shadows.
entry.content:
The custom with-shadow border color isn't really visible in dark mode,

and it isn't necessary to use a different color than the standard one.

The only distinction the "with shadows" version has is whether to

draw a border at all, which is controlled separately than "what is the

color".

entry.title: Added an ApplyAutofillAction function in the renderer
entry.content:
This CL:

-Adds a mojom::AutofillFormAction enum denoting the browser autofill

operation that sent a form to the renderer.

-Adds an ApplyAutofillAction function to form_util with intent to merge

the two deleted functions.

-Adapts FillFormField and PreviewFormField and ClearPreviewedElements

to handle both Fill and Undo operations.

-Fixes typos and clang warnings in touched files



The overall chain of CLs adds a preview feature to the existing Undo

functionality. Up until this CL, the browser has the required logic and

sends the necessary information to the renderer. This CL's goal is to

first make Undo previewable and second merge the Undo and Fill functions

in the renderer because they are highly similar.



Bug: 1441410

Change-Id: Id2ce96d4df2318469a2a2578257040840009e30c

entry.title: Revert "tracing: use default ShmemMode in creating the arbiter"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fffb3dad916cefa609fff763742e0cad9b8d1033.



Reason for revert:

Some MemoryTracingIntegrationTest.* and TracingObserverProtoTest.* tests started failing after this CL



First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25786/overview



Original change's description:

> tracing: use default ShmemMode in creating the arbiter

>

> This CL is a manual roll of perfetto with a fix in Chrome. The perfetto

> upstream introduces the ShmemMode parameter in creating the

> SharedMemoryArbiter in aosp/2627899 and causes breakage in tracing. Fix

> by passing ShmemMode::kDefault (supporting cross-process Shmem) in

> creating the arbiter. Also include a fix of perfetto unittest for

> fuchsia (aosp/2696480).

>

> This CL manually rolls perfetto from 446adf5b7bb4 to 8e8917c609bd

> (36 revisions).

> https://android.googlesource.com/platform/external/perfetto.git/+log/446adf5b7bb4..8e8917c609bd

entry.title: Revert "[X-Device Restore] Fix unexpected omnibox focus on tab switcher"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8910e7d3e2e0860024cdaa9d5fb0f563491e77b4.



Reason for revert: The following bugs - crbug.com/1470967, crbug.com/1470996, crbug.com/1471037, crbug.com/1470986 seem to be caused by the change here.



Bug: 1470967, 1470996, 1471037, 1470986, 1467797



Original change's description:

> [X-Device Restore] Fix unexpected omnibox focus on tab switcher

>

> This CL aims to fix an issue where the omnibox is unexpectedly focused during tab switcher usage, presumably in cases when there is nothing to focus on the screen. A gated if-check will be removed, as the original bug https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1178857 is not visible after this change.

>

> Removing the gated check allows the logic afterwards to properly set the omnibox focus during tab switcher use as well as transitions into and out of the tab switcher.

>

entry.title: [Extensions Cleanup] Move CanShowActionsInToolbar to ToolbarModel
entry.content:
CanShowActionsInToolbar was computed in the extensions container because

that was the only view that needed that value. However,

chrome://extensions also need to know if an extension can be shown

in the toolbar. Therefore, we can move this to the ToolbarModel which

arguably is a better place since we are computing a value for actions.

entry.title: Revert "Cros network service sandbox: Unsandboxed if kerberos is enabled"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5dfa5d11f4e10058d0bafefe754b8126a345233d.



Reason for revert:

SystemNetworkContextManagerNetworkServiceSandboxEnabledBrowsertest.NetworkServiceRestartsUnsandboxedOnKerberosEnabled

is failing on Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan

First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/52807/overview



Original change's description:

> Cros network service sandbox: Unsandboxed if kerberos is enabled

>

> The Linux/cros network service sandbox is incompatible with kerberos.

> So, the network service will start unsandboxed if kerberos is

> enabled, regardless of feature state or enterprise policy.

>

> The KerberosEnabled enterprise policy can change at runtime. If it

> flips to enabled, shut down the network service so it restarts

> unsandboxed. This is not a sandbox hole because only admins

> can enable kerberos.

>

> Change-Id: I4ae1356f31c3f9182a0db803a2ee22ec7bd1744e

> Bug: 1079808

entry.title: ChromeOS: Add chrome://chrome-urls to the acceptable URLs
entry.content:
This CL makes `GetListOfAcceptableURLs()` include chrome://chrome-urls.



This change resolves the following issues:

- In Ash, middle-clicking on the "chrome://about" link in the os://about

(or os://chrome-urls) page opens an Ash browser window in LacrosOnly.

- Lacros does not accept "os://chrome-urls" in the address bar.



Bug: 1457122, 1444283

Change-Id: I3f4810c18505c507df2855ea891a3f2c697483f4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4659169

Commit-Queue: Jun Ishiguro

Reviewed-by: Georg Neis

Reviewed-by: John Lee

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181294}

entry.title: Lacros: Change OpenURLFromTab to open the URL in the proper browser
entry.content:
This CL fixes URL handling issues that allow Ash browser to open when

the user clicks a link in SWA while pressing the shift or control key.

If Lacros is the only browser, that link should be opened in Lacros.

Before this CL, such links opened an Ash browser.



Bug: 1444283, 1450061

Change-Id: I860cce343e38fe881d20e1cc38bc16153ddaf824

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4570024

Reviewed-by: Nasko Oskov

Reviewed-by: Dana Fried

Commit-Queue: Jun Ishiguro

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181284}

entry.title: language_packs: Make Status enum Extensible
entry.content:
The Enum PackState should have been made Extensible from the beginning.

The plan is to make UKNOWN the default and in the future deprecate

ERROR.

The error is now provided in the dedicated ErrorCode enum.



Bug: b:294162606

Change-Id: Iab42ee0ce9e1e7d23c1521e51873cfd3e1bc8426

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4754005

Reviewed-by: Michael Cui

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181283}
